descr.name: Activation of CDK1 in human Jurkat T cells overexpressing Bcl2 assessed as decrease in p-CDK1 Tyr-15 level at 7.5 to 30 ug/ml by Western blot analysis
description: Title: Induction of microtubule-damage, mitotic arrest, Bcl-2 phosphorylation, Bak activation, and mitochondria-dependent caspase cascade is involved in human Jurkat T-cell apoptosis by aruncin B from Aruncus dioicus var. kamtschaticus.

Abstract: Exposure of human Jurkat T cells to aruncin B, purified from Aruncus dioicus, caused apoptosis along with microtubule damage, G(2)/M-arrest, Bcl-2 phosphorylation, Bak activation, mitochondrial membrane potential ( inverted question mark inverted question markm) loss, cytochrome c release, activation of multiple caspases, and PARP degradation. Analyses by employing Bcl-2 overexpression and selective caspase inhibitors revealed that G(2)/M-arrest and Bcl-2 phosphorylation occurred prior to mitochondria-dependent activation of caspase-9, -3, and -8. The IC(50) values for human resting T cells, activated T cells, and Jurkat T cells were >60 inverted question markg/ml, 49 inverted question markg/ml, and 22 inverted question markg/ml, respectively. These results demonstrate the apoptogenic activity of a novel microtubule-damaging agent aruncin B.
comment: ChEMBL Target Type: SINGLE PROTEIN - Target is a single protein chain
Relationship Type: D - Direct protein target assigned
Confidence: Direct single protein target assigned

results.name: Standard Type
description: Standardized activity type (e.g. IC50 rather than Ic-50/Ic50/ic50/ic-50)
